alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, northwestern Laurel, Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and southern Rockcastle Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bee Lick to near Parnell. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Spiro, Maretburg, Wabp, Bromo, Quail, Ottowa, Level Green, Willailla, Hansford and Bee Lick around 1220 PM EDT. Mount Vernon, Wellhope, Burr, Sand Springs and Pongo around 1225 PM EDT. Sinks, Pine Hill, Withers, Donaro, Sand Hill, Betsey, Flat Rock, Dudley Station, Orlando and Luner around 1230 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Delta, Horse Lick, Gauley, Lamero, Jep Hill, Gregory, Denney, Camp Wildcat, Kidder, Ritner, Eberle, Carico, Cruise, Templer, Parrot, Ardery, Middlefork, Mershons, Victory, Tateville, Deese, Dabolt, Alpine and Sloans Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
